newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish air passenger volume up five pct in H1.
newsitem.headline: Swedish air passenger volume up five pct in H1.

text.p: Sweden's civil aviation authority Luftfartsverket said on Monday air passenger volumes increased by five percent in the first half of 1996 to 8.6 million passengers.
Domestic passenger traffic rose nine percent to 5.5 million people, Luftfartsverket said in a statement.
"Behind the continued increase in domestic traffic is a higher number of leisure travellers as well as the export industry's success," the group said.
Intra-European traffic, which accounted for 93 percent of international traffic, rose eight percent.

At the same time, state-owned Luftfartsverket, which owns 14 civil airports and operates five other civil and military airports in Sweden, posted a profit of 123 million crowns for the first half of 1996.
It posted a profit of 153 million crowns in the same 1995 period.
